parameters.name: AwsAccountId
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

parameters.name: DataSourceId
parameters.description: The ID of the data source. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: DataSource
nested_items.description: The information on the data source.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the data source.

nested_items.name: DataSourceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the data source. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: A display name for the data source.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of the data source. This type indicates which database engine the data source connects to.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The HTTP status of the request.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The time that this data source was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The last time that this data source was updated.

nested_items.name: DataSourceParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters that Amazon QuickSight uses to connect to your underlying source. This is a variant type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be non-null.

nested_items.name: WorkGroup
nested_items.description: The workgroup that Amazon Athena uses.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: Use the RoleArn structure to override an account-wide role for a specific Athena data source. For example, say an account administrator has turned off all Athena access with an account-wide role. The administrator can then use RoleArn to bypass the account-wide role and allow Athena access for the single Athena data source that is specified in the structure, even if the account-wide role forbidding Athena access is still active.

nested_items.name: IdentityCenterConfiguration
nested_items.description: An optional parameter that configures IAM Identity Center authentication to grant Amazon QuickSight access to your workgroup.

nested_items.name: EnableIdentityPropagation
nested_items.description: A Boolean option that controls whether Trusted Identity Propagation should be used.

nested_items.name: AuroraParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters for Amazon Aurora MySQL.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: The Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible host to connect to.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port that Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL is listening on.

nested_items.name: Database
nested_items.description: The Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL database to connect to.

nested_items.name: SiteBaseUrl
nested_items.description: The base URL of the Jira site.

nested_items.name: UseServiceName
nested_items.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the Database uses a service name or an SID. If this value is left blank, the default value is SID. If this value is set to false, the value is SID.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: Host. This field can be blank if ClusterId is provided.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Port. This field can be blank if the ClusterId is provided.

nested_items.name: ClusterId
nested_items.description: Cluster ID. This field can be blank if the Host and Port are provided.

nested_items.name: IAMParameters
nested_items.description: An optional parameter that uses IAM authentication to grant Amazon QuickSight access to your cluster. This parameter can be used instead of DataSourceCredentials.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: Use the RoleArn structure to allow Amazon QuickSight to call redshift:GetClusterCredentials on your cluster. The calling principal must have iam:PassRole access to pass the role to Amazon QuickSight. The role's trust policy must allow the Amazon QuickSight service principal to assume the role.

nested_items.name: DatabaseUser
nested_items.description: The user whose permissions and group memberships will be used by Amazon QuickSight to access the cluster. If this user already exists in your database, Amazon QuickSight is granted the same permissions that the user has. If the user doesn't exist, set the value of AutoCreateDatabaseUser to True to create a new user with PUBLIC permissions.

nested_items.name: DatabaseGroups
nested_items.description: A list of groups whose permissions will be granted to Amazon QuickSight to access the cluster. These permissions are combined with the permissions granted to Amazon QuickSight by the DatabaseUser. If you choose to include this parameter, the RoleArn must grant access to redshift:JoinGroup.

nested_items.name: AutoCreateDatabaseUser
nested_items.description: Automatically creates a database user. If your database doesn't have a DatabaseUser, set this parameter to True. If there is no DatabaseUser, Amazon QuickSight can't connect to your cluster. The RoleArn that you use for this operation must grant access to redshift:CreateClusterUser to successfully create the user.

nested_items.name: IdentityCenterConfiguration
nested_items.description: An optional parameter that configures IAM Identity Center authentication to grant Amazon QuickSight access to your cluster.

nested_items.name: EnableIdentityPropagation
nested_items.description: A Boolean option that controls whether Trusted Identity Propagation should be used.

nested_items.name: ManifestFileLocation
nested_items.description: Location of the Amazon S3 manifest file. This is NULL if the manifest file was uploaded into Amazon QuickSight.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: Amazon S3 key that identifies an object.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: Use the RoleArn structure to override an account-wide role for a specific S3 data source. For example, say an account administrator has turned off all S3 access with an account-wide role. The administrator can then use RoleArn to bypass the account-wide role and allow S3 access for the single S3 data source that is specified in the structure, even if the account-wide role forbidding S3 access is still active.

nested_items.name: AuthenticationType
nested_items.description: The authentication type that you want to use for your connection. This parameter accepts OAuth and non-OAuth authentication types.

nested_items.name: OAuthParameters
nested_items.description: An object that contains information needed to create a data source connection between an Amazon QuickSight account and Snowflake.

nested_items.name: TokenProviderUrl
nested_items.description: The token endpoint URL of the identity provider.

nested_items.name: VpcConnectionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the VPC connection.

nested_items.name: IdentityProviderResourceUri
nested_items.description: The resource uri of the identity provider.

nested_items.name: MaxRows
nested_items.description: Maximum number of rows to query Twitter.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: The hostname or IP address of the Exasol data source.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port for the Exasol data source.

nested_items.name: DatabricksParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters that are required to connect to a Databricks data source.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: The host name of the Databricks data source.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port for the Databricks data source.

nested_items.name: SqlEndpointPath
nested_items.description: The HTTP path of the Databricks data source.

nested_items.name: StarburstParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters that are required to connect to a Starburst data source.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: The host name of the Starburst data source.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port for the Starburst data source.

nested_items.name: Catalog
nested_items.description: The catalog name for the Starburst data source.

nested_items.name: ProductType
nested_items.description: The product type for the Starburst data source.

nested_items.name: AuthenticationType
nested_items.description: The authentication type that you want to use for your connection. This parameter accepts OAuth and non-OAuth authentication types.

nested_items.name: OAuthParameters
nested_items.description: An object that contains information needed to create a data source connection between an Amazon QuickSight account and Starburst.

nested_items.name: TokenProviderUrl
nested_items.description: The token endpoint URL of the identity provider.

nested_items.name: VpcConnectionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the VPC connection.

nested_items.name: IdentityProviderResourceUri
nested_items.description: The resource uri of the identity provider.

nested_items.name: TrinoParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters that are required to connect to a Trino data source.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: The host name of the Trino data source.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port for the Trino data source.

nested_items.name: Catalog
nested_items.description: The catalog name for the Trino data source.

nested_items.name: BigQueryParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters that are required to connect to a Google BigQuery data source.

nested_items.name: ProjectId
nested_items.description: The Google Cloud Platform project ID where your datasource was created.

nested_items.name: DataSetRegion
nested_items.description: The storage location where you create a Google BigQuery data source.

nested_items.name: AlternateDataSourceParameters
nested_items.description: A set of alternate data source parameters that you want to share for the credentials stored with this data source. The credentials are applied in tandem with the data source parameters when you copy a data source by using a create or update request. The API operation compares the DataSourceParameters structure that's in the request with the structures in the AlternateDataSourceParameters allow list. If the structures are an exact match, the request is allowed to use the credentials from this existing data source. If the AlternateDataSourceParameters list is null, the Credentials originally used with this DataSourceParameters are automatically allowed.

nested_items.name: WorkGroup
nested_items.description: The workgroup that Amazon Athena uses.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: Use the RoleArn structure to override an account-wide role for a specific Athena data source. For example, say an account administrator has turned off all Athena access with an account-wide role. The administrator can then use RoleArn to bypass the account-wide role and allow Athena access for the single Athena data source that is specified in the structure, even if the account-wide role forbidding Athena access is still active.

nested_items.name: BigQueryParameters

nested_items.name: DataSetRegion

nested_items.name: VpcConnectionProperties
nested_items.description: The VPC connection information. You need to use this parameter only when you want Amazon QuickSight to use a VPC connection when connecting to your underlying source.

nested_items.name: VpcConnectionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the VPC connection.

nested_items.name: SslProperties
nested_items.description: Secure Socket Layer (SSL) properties that apply when Amazon QuickSight connects to your underlying source.

nested_items.name: DisableSsl
nested_items.description: A Boolean option to control whether SSL should be disabled.

nested_items.name: ErrorInfo
nested_items.description: Error information from the last update or the creation of the data source.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the secret associated with the data source in Amazon Secrets Manager.

nested_items.name: RequestId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The HTTP status of the request.
